claim.text: The authors extracted and profiled 10,393 statements from IPCC AR6 reports with associated uncertainty levels and glossary terms
claim.exact_quote: We represent the 10,393 statements from the latest IPCC reports (AR6) with associated uncertainty levels and glossary terms.

evidence.evidence_text: Total number of statements extracted is explicitly stated
evidence.exact_quote: We obtained 10,393 statements, which is in excess of the 8,094 statements extracted by Lacombe, Wu, and Dilworth (2023)

conclusion.limitations: No validation of extraction accuracy provided

claim.text: HTML parsing is more reliable than PDF extraction for IPCC reports despite recent developments in PDF extraction tools
claim.exact_quote: While the PDF versions of the reports are available, we find HTML parsing more reliable despite recent developments in PDF extraction tools

conclusion.limitations: No evidence or comparison provided to support HTML vs PDF reliability claim

claim.text: Over 90% of statements in the dataset have confidence levels above medium
claim.exact_quote: Over 90% of the overall statements have confidence levels above medium (i.e., medium, high, or very high)

evidence.evidence_text: Confidence level distribution is explicitly stated
evidence.exact_quote: Over 90% of the overall statements have confidence levels above medium (i.e., medium, high, or very high)

conclusion.limitations: Only applies to statements with confidence levels, not full dataset

claim.text: High confidence is the most common confidence level for statements in most chapters except chapter bodies of WGI and WGIII reports
claim.exact_quote: high confidence is the most common confidence level for statements in most chapters, except for those in the chapter bodies of the WGI and WGIII reports

conclusion.limitations: Specific distribution numbers not provided, relies on interpretation of Figure 2

claim.text: 91.3% of statements with confidence levels and 84.9% of statements with likelihood levels contain at least one key term
claim.exact_quote: 91.3% of C and 84.9% of L contain at least one key term

evidence.evidence_text: Exact percentages of statements with key terms
evidence.exact_quote: 91.3% of C and 84.9% of L contain at least one key term

conclusion.limitations: No details on distribution of number of key terms per statement

claim.text: GPT-generated statements lack uncertainty assessment information and supporting references compared to the authors' extracted statements
claim.exact_quote: As mentioned in Case Study 2, such references provide important scientific evidence supporting the statements. Additionally, the GPT-generated statements lack uncertainty assessment information as we do.

evidence.evidence_text: Comparison with GPT outputs shows lack of uncertainty info
evidence.limitations: Limited to one case study example
evidence.exact_quote: Additionally, the GPT-generated statements lack uncertainty assessment information as we do. Confidence and likelihood levels are crucial for evaluating the validity and probability of the statements.

conclusion.limitations: Based on limited comparison examples, may not be representative of all GPT outputs
